subject: Chisel This On Your Gravestone
body:
Chisel This On Your Gravestone







We love giving our InvestorPlace.com members benefits like access to this timely message.
In order to ensure you keep receiving special alerts and offers like this one, please take a moment to click on any of the links in this message to reconfirm that this is the email address where you want to receive emails from InvestorPlace.com
FOUR  WORDS
My wish for you is a long and  prosperous life, but when you confront your final days, surrounded I trust by  your adoring family and a multitude of friends, I hope you will take your  youngest grandchild or great grandchild—a clever little protégé, no doubt—and  whisper 4 words into that shell-like ear before you go to your eternal reward.
Those are the 4 words that made you  wealthy.
Those same 4 words will ring in  your grandchild’s ears for years, as your magnificent legacy is spent on  expensive schools and powerful automobiles.  But because this child loves and misses you, he or she will sometimes  visit your grave, where (just in case) those same 4 words can be read, chiseled  at your instructions in rather large type, right into your marble headstone.
One day, your legacy gone and that  child an adult, he or she will use those 4 words to build a NEW legacy, even  richer and more magnificent than yours.  
And you will look down (I hope  down, not up!) and approve.  
Your work will be complete.
Here Are Those 4 Words:
They are simple-deceptively simple.
They call for you to understand  that China’s rise is the most significant economic and social event of our  era—and one RIFE with investment opportunities.
They call for you to grasp that  China’s rise is, first and foremost, an INDUSTRIAL surge.
The scale of this industrialization  defies description.  Groups of  American investors I have taken through China’s rarely-visited industrial  hinterlands stand blinking in disbelief when they see, stretching as far as the  eye can see in the dust and haze, mills and factories and substations and  top-heavy trucks and a multitude of blackened faces—often of children.  
My American friends get back on the  tour bus and sit in silence for the next hour trying to assimilate what they  just witnessed.
It is at the end of that hour of  stunned silence that I step to the bus microphone and say these 4 words:
